children.subject: Sorry for the late reply - yes, we will have one final project at the end of the semester.
Will there be projects in this class?
Not finalized - but within the next few days
When will we hear back about decisions after applying? Thank you!
We will make decisions within the next few days. We don't anticipate anyone needing to drop the class, since it's based mostly on effort and not on correctness.
I would also like to know when decisions will take place, specifically today, because of the free drop deadline today.
Sent the audit form a day after the Sep 3rd deadline. Will my application still be considered?
I got a response email yesterday but it ended up in my spam

history.content:
Machine Learning at Berkeley will be teaching a DeCal course this fall called “Recommendation Systems in Machine Learning” (CS 198-100). The course is being sponsored by Professor Anca Dragan (though please direct all emails to recsys.fa21@gmail.com) Here is a bit of information about it:

Ever wondered how companies like Facebook, Tiktok, Amazon, and Netflix are able to keep users hooked to their content? Businesses are increasingly looking to recruit engineers who can build recommendation systems, as they rake in billions in sales for these companies.

In this class, we will be teaching how these systems work from the ground-up. We will explore content-based and collaborative filtering paradigms, architectures using statistical methods, deep learning, CNNs, autoencoders, RNNs, Transformers, GANs, and deep RL. We’ll also delve into scoring, re-ranking, evaluation, deployment, ethics, decision-making psychology, and adversarial attacks.

CS 61A-level Python programming experience and EECS 16A/Math 54-level linear algebra experience will be enough to take the class. Experience in ML will be helpful but is not required.

The application is due this Friday, September 3, 2021 at 11:59 PM. The class is synchronous and online, with lectures on Wednesdays at 5:30 - 7:00 PM.

More information about the class and application links are live at https://ml.berkeley.edu/decal/rec-sys. Hope to see you apply!
